isis.stitle: Recall 98304 - 5 Spoke Rear Wheel Assemblies on GENESIS and AmTran RE Buses

recall.subject: 5 Spoke Rear Wheel Assemblies on GENESIS and AmTran RE Buses

defect.para: This Recall applies to AmTran RE and GENESIS buses built from September 1, 1997 through September 17, 1998.
American Transportation Corporation (AmTran) has determined that a defect relating to motor vehicle safety exists in some AmTran vehicles in connection with the 5 spoke rear wheel assemblies.

The buses contained in this recall have five-spoke rear wheel assemblies that could have mismatched parts. Should the five-spoke rear wheel assembly have mismatched parts, this could cause high stress on the wheel studs and potential wheel stud failures. Over a period of time, with multiple stud failures a wheel separation could result. This defect could cause a vehicular accident without warning which could result in personal injury or property damage, or both.
Owners have been notified of this recall and have been directed to contact an AmTran or GENESIS dealer to make arrangements for inspection and remedy of the defect.

svcproc.title: INSPECTION

step1.para: On air braked buses, inspect for "RX269" cast on one of the wheel/hub spokes and on hydraulic braked buses inspect for "RX270" cast on one of the wheel/hub spokes. (Refer to Figure 1.)
Measure the width of the wheel spacer using a 4 inch strip of cardboard to insure that the spacer is 4 inches wide and not 3.6 inches wide.
Inspect rim clamp. The rim clamp must have the part number "W1138" on the face of the clamp.

para.emph: If the wheel/hub has "RX269" or "RX270" cast on one of the spokes and you find the rim measuring less than 4.0 inches wide and/or the rim clamps not identified as "W1138" on the face of the clamp, corrective action must be taken.

svcproc.para: Corrective action requires replacing the studs in the wheel/hub, replacing the wheel spacers and installing new wheel clamps and nuts. Please complete and return the "AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card checking box #8 and writing in your UPS shipping address.

Wheel assemblies identified with "RX269" or "RX270" cast on one of the wheel/hub spokes with 4 inch rim spacers and rim clamps stamped "W1138" do not require any corrective action. Please complete and return the "AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card checking box #1 and install a Campaign Identification Label (see instructions below).

svcproc.title: REPAIR
svcproc.para: Corrective action requires replacing the studs in the wheel/hub, replacing the wheel spacers and installing new wheel clamps and nuts.

warning.para: Refer to your truck service manual for precautions when removing or installing tire and rim assemblies and/or clamps. Failure to follow proper procedures for removal of tire and rim assemblies and/or clamps could result in personal injury and/or property damage.

step1.para: Remove and discard the wheel clamps and nuts.
Remove the outer tire and rim assembly.
Remove and discard the 5 studs from the wheel/hub using a stud remover or double nut method.
Do not use the new nuts supplied to remove or install the studs.

item.para: The standout of the stud from surface of the wheel/hub should be approximately 2 (two) inches.
The torque range should be 120-192 ft-lbs.
Use caution not to bottom the nut on the shoulder of the stud if using the double nut procedure.
Make sure to install the short threaded end of the stud into the wheel/hub.

step1.para: Remove and discard the rim spacer and install the new 4 (four) inch rim spacer.
Install the outer tire and rim assembly.
Install the wheel clamps and nuts.
Torque wheel clamp nuts to 190-210 ft-lbs.
Repeat this procedure for the opposite side of the axle.
Complete and return the owners postage-paid "Recall - Repair Reply Card."

svcproc.para: Complete and return the owners' postage-paid "AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card checking box #1 or #2.

entry.para: Replace spacer, studs, clamps and nuts

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. As a precaution, you should not operate any of the vehicles subject to this recall campaign until they have been inspected for the presence of the nut assembled to the pinch bolt. In the event that the nut is missing, repairs must be made before the vehicle is driven. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner's vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his or her vehicle as soon as possible.
